intro: Clibadium leptophyllum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved sida, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its narrow, linear leaves and small, yellowish-white flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands or along stream banks. Clibadium leptophyllum is an annual herb that plays a role in local ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various insects and small animals.
